title: scanorama_leiden
description: Run scanorama integration followed by neighbour calculations, leiden clustering and run umap on the result.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

id.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample
id.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `dataset.h5mu`. Path to the sample
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `dataset.h5mu`. Path to the sample.

layer.description: Type: `string`, default: `log_normalized`. use specified layer for expression values instead of the
layer.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `log_normalized`. use specified layer for expression values instead of the .X object from the modality.

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Destination path to the output
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Destination path to the output.

uns_neighbors.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `scanorama_integration_neighbors`. In which .uns slot to store various neighbor output objects.

obsp_neighbor_distances.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `scanorama_integration_distances`. In which .obsp slot to store the distance matrix between the resulting neighbors.

obsp_neighbor_connectivities.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `scanorama_integration_connectivities`. In which .obsp slot to store the connectivities matrix between the resulting neighbors.

obs_batch.description: Type: `string`, default: `sample_id`. Column name discriminating between your batches
obs_batch.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `sample_id`. Column name discriminating between your batches.

obsm_input.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_pca`. .obsm slot that points to embedding to run scanorama on.

obsm_output.description: Type: `string`, default: `X_scanorama`. The name of the field in adata
obsm_output.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_scanorama`. The name of the field in adata.obsm where the integrated embeddings will be stored after running this function. Defaults to X_scanorama.

knn.description: Type: `integer`, default: `20`. Number of nearest neighbors to use for matching
knn.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `20`. Number of nearest neighbors to use for matching.

batch_size.description: Type: `integer`, default: `5000`. The batch size used in the alignment vector computation
batch_size.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `5000`. The batch size used in the alignment vector computation. Useful when integrating very large (>100k samples) datasets. Set to large value that runs within available memory.

sigma.description: Type: `double`, default: `15.0`. Correction smoothing parameter on Gaussian kernel
sigma.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `15.0`. Correction smoothing parameter on Gaussian kernel.

approx.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Use approximate nearest neighbors with Python annoy; greatly speeds up matching runtime
approx.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Use approximate nearest neighbors with Python annoy; greatly speeds up matching runtime.

alpha.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.1`. Alignment score minimum cutoff
alpha.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `0.1`. Alignment score minimum cutoff

obs_cluster.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `scanorama_integration_leiden`. Prefix for the .obs keys under which to add the cluster labels. Newly created columns in .obs will 
be created from the specified value for '--obs_cluster' suffixed with an underscore and one of the
resolutions specified in '--leiden_resolution'.

leiden_resolution.description: Type: List of `double`, default: `1.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Control the coarseness of the clustering
leiden_resolution.help_text: Type: List of `double`, default: `1.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Control the coarseness of the clustering. Higher values lead to more clusters.

obsm_umap.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_leiden_scanorama_umap`. In which .obsm slot to store the resulting UMAP embedding.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
